item.description:
Bugfixes

  • Fixed ElevenLabs TTS failing with a 403 error despite having AI credits.

  • Improved AI functionality in tables.

  • Moved "Image" above "Right Floating Image" in slash commands.

  • Fixed dark mode in the keyboard shortcut dialog and improved iconography.

  • Fixed document content not rendering when switching documents from the sidebar while a PDF is open with the editor on the left.

  • Added basic undo/redo functionality to the omnibar.

  • Fixed new table cell list items becoming orphaned.

  • Fixed flashcards not appearing after a page reload.

  • Fixed cloze cards not working properly in grid tables.

  • Cleaned up custom scheduler settings.

  • Improved grid table portals.

  • Fixed flashcard counter tap issues in the queue on mobile.

  • Fixed card table preview popup being cut off on mobile.

  • Fixed merge columns in tables showing extra elements.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where highlighting text in PDFs triggered the system Copy/Paste popup.

  • Improved Markdown export by URL-encoding paths to Rems.

  • Enabled "Edit Now" for tables to work in the queue.

  • Added Sonnet 3.7 (reasoning and non-reasoning) to the list of supported AI chat models.

  • Fixed a typo in the "Practice cards with images?" screen.

  • Updated the Magic Copy-Paste and Rewrite language dropdowns to use the standard language selector component.

  • Fixed formatting issues on the 404 page.

  • Fixed an issue where the AI Tutor keyboard dismissed incorrectly on mobile.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed area highlight sometimes not working on mobile.

  • Fixed issues preventing clicks on table properties in user knowledge bases.

  • Fixed definition card table type not responding to configuration changes.

  • Fixed incorrect rendering of the horizontal scrollbar in grid tables.

  • Fixed dark mode issue with filter input fields.

  • Fixed inability to collapse long advanced tables with filters.

  • Disabled the "You can also press Tab to indent" message for tables.

  • Added an insight for Explanation flashcards.

  • Fixed multiple table-related issues.

  • Fixed issue where selecting multiple files at once didn't upload all of them.

  • Fixed resizing PDF area highlights causing them to disappear.

  • Improved language handling in magic copy-paste.

  • Fixed flashcard indicator arrow disappearing in PDF viewer notes after creating a card.

  • Replaced grid table setting labels with tooltips.

  • Ensured the cursor stays in view when using horizontal keyboard navigation.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed a crash when enabling or disabling AI features while the PDF reader is open.

  • Added new table shortcuts.

  • Fixed various table issues and polished the UI.

  • Fixed stuck selection when dragging off the page while making a PDF area highlight.

  • Fixed PDF Annotator focusing on the left part of the PDF after zooming and resizing.

  • Fixed tag filters not working.

  • Fixed all notes filters being hidden under the bottom bar.

  • Improved tables with multiple bug fixes and UI enhancements.

  • Fixed the "Practice All Flashcards in Order" option for the Cards Table practice.

  • Fixed image cells not expanding fully in full-height tables.

  • Hid "flashcard configuration" on the primary column.

Improvements & Bugfixes

  • Add AI autofill for tables.

  • Fixed slow loading on the web.

  • Fixed the daily template selector not appearing reactively.

  • Prevented table occlusion cards from scrolling away when showing insights.

  • Fixed an issue on mobile where applying too large a zoom caused the PDF annotator to jump.

  • Fixed a flickering issue when clicking on a yellow highlight in the "Create AI Cards" popup.

  • Cleaned up names of flashcard keyboard shortcuts.

Bugfixes

  • Improved iOS app stability when switching between apps.

  • Fixed iOS sign-in getting stuck on step 3/3 for some larger knowledge bases.

  • Made route change undo more meaningful.

  • Fixed multiple issues with the Markdown exporter.

  • Fixed checkboxes not immediately appearing when converting a single-line card into a multi-line card in the queue.

  • Fixed some cards incorrectly appearing with a flag despite no exam being set in the knowledge base.

  • Fixed a weird login message.

  • Fixed issues selecting some cards in the cards table.

  • Fixed React errors when scrolling in certain knowledge bases.

  • Improved etymology parsing when adding cards.

  • Fixed handling of multiple PDFs in the upload selector on mobile.

  • Fixed PDF highlight previews mistakenly replacing newlines with an empty string.

  • Fixed some tags not displaying when another tag is deleted.

  • Defaulted AI features to English.

  • Added support for AI converting images to tables.

  • Fixed ElevenLabs English voices.

  • Made it less annoying if you accidentally pick "Import" instead of "Upload" and vice versa.

item.title: 1.18.52 (Labs) - Grid Tables, Occlusion Tables, and new Advanced Tables in Labs!
item.description:
Enable these new experimental features by going to Settings > Labs > Grid Tables Labs.

Please share feedback on these experimental features in Discord! We have a number of additional upgrades to them coming shortly as well.

New in Labs - Grid Tables

You can now add a Grid Table! These are perfect for flashcards, organized data, grids of information, and more.

After enabling the “Grid Tables Labs” setting, add a grid table with /grid table.

Or, use the bottom toolbar

Grid tables are easy to manipulate. You can type directly in any cell, drag to add new rows/columns, format, add cards, and more.

Grid tables are standalone - you can think of them as a self-contained grid of cells. You don’t need to worry about tags, linking, etc. (If you do want those, scroll down to “Advanced Tables” at the bottom of this changelog!)

Formatting

Format grid tables with colors, highlights, text formats, text alignment, and more.

Format entire rows/columns:

Or, drag to select and then format any individual cells:

Tables On Multi-Line Cards

Add grid tables anywhere. For example, you can add them on the back of a multi-line flashcard, and they’ll appear in your flashcards queue:

Headers Rows/Columns

Hide or show headers (the gray rows / columns) based on your needs.

New in Labs - Tables Flashcard Options

“Show Entire Table” Mode

You can now test the entirety of a table on a flashcard! From the “cards” menu on your table, switch to “Show Entire Table”.

You’ll be tested on every cell, one by one:

Each cell still tracks its own spaced repetition history, and has its own schedule. If you get some cells wrong, they’ll come back separately to test you on them, per their own spaced repetition schedule.

Enabling Cards in Tables
You can enable individual cells from the cell’s “…” menu:

Or individual columns:

Or the entire table from the "cards” menu! In the cards menu, you can quick-configure which columns to practice, and if you’ll be tested in order or not.

“Type in Answer” and “Text to Speech” Options for Columns

In a column’s “Configure Cards” menu, you can now enable “type in answer” and ”text to speech” at the columns level. All flashcards in this column will have these settings applied.

Premium Text to Speech for Columns

For language learners, we’ve also added premium Elevenlabs text to speech to tables. Enable the text-to-speech to learn the pronunciation of words in the language of your choice.

New In Labs - Advanced Tables

We’ve redesigned the existing tables feature, and renamed them “Advanced Tables”.

New Look and Feel

Advanced tables now have a nicer top-row. We’ve emphasized the title more, added an easier “Add Row” button, and cleaned up the config buttons.

By default, table rows now have the standard “zoom in” bullet instead of the “Open” button. This keeps the “name” column cleaner on tables where you don’t frequently zoom in.

For tables where you frequently zoom in, we’ve added a “Turn Every Row into a Document” option. This brings back the “Open” button on each row, and visually distinguishes them:

Standalone Advanced Tables

Tables are still powered by tags in the backend, but we’ve significantly de-emphasized tags in the new setup. (If you still like using tags, read below! Everything is still supported).


All rows for the table are now stored directly in the table itself, without creating a separate tag in the “Tags” page. When you zoom into a table row, you’ll now see the document you came from in the breadcrumbs at the top of your document. This makes navigation and table manipulation easier.

When you create a table with /table, it’s now treated as a special “primary table” where the information is stored. If you create other views to the table’s tag (using /existing table), a “↗” arrow will appear to indicate that this is a “secondary” table.

Using Tables and Tags

If you prefer the existing setup where you create a tag first, you can stick with that! Just make a document for your tag, then use the /existing table command to make a table to it. For example, we still think this is a great way to organize #Ideas, #Projects, etc. from across your knowledge base. Note that we’ve also simplified down the “tags” pages, to help you focus on your own notes without excessive extra elements on the screen.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed labs setting referencing a removed settings option.

  • Fix routing getting stuck on web when a new version is available.

  • Improved importing - allowed matching Obsidian documents based on their name without requiring the full path.

  • Fixed an issue where "Why True" was appearing even when not applicable.

  • Fixed the pricing tier grid not spanning the full width on mobile.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where text highlights in some PDFs selected the entire width instead of the intended area.

  • Fixed misplaced area highlights in non-standard size PDFs.

  • Improved visibility of the horizontal scrollbar in dark mode when viewing PDFs in the annotator.

  • Fixed AI chat titles and restored tutor chats in Intercom.

  • Disabled the "Key Points" feature in PDFs for now.

  • Fixed the horizontal scrollbar in the flashcards table being out of order.

  • Ensured the selected range rem is scrolled into view after creating cards from an AI tutor chat message.

  • Removed the shadow on the gutter image node if the image is empty.

  • Fixed an issue where selecting text in the summary section was not possible if focus was already in the editor.

  • Added a banner at the bottom of quiz generation when fewer flashcards are generated than requested.

  • Fixed the "Are you trying to make a portal?" message appearing incorrectly when creating flashcards from image highlights.

  • Disabled the "Adjust Cards" option until cards have been generated.

  • Provided a better error message when pasting a URL to a PDF that requires login or browser interaction to download.

  • Improved the UI for the "Please wait while we download the PDF file from our server" screen.

  • Fixed certain deck selections causing crashes in the Anki importer.

  • Fixed anchor links not working inside the web reader.

  • Added the ability to disable keyboard shortcuts.

  • Unified padding in queue indicator icons.

  • Fixed AI generation language defaulting to English.

  • Updated the media kit.

  • Fixed spacing in the queue button tooltip.

  • Fixed the mobile flashcards home being cut off at the bottom.

Improvements

  • Added support for Gemini Flash 2 in AI chat.

  • You can now generate as many extra questions as you want for quizzes.

  • Improved AI quizzes to stream questions one by one.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue on iOS where clicking a PDF reference didn’t scroll to the corresponding page in the PDF Annotator.
